node.title: Borders set to reopen, but vaccination rates still flagging in poorer and multicultural communities
node.alt: Indigenous children being vaccinated at an SA Health event at Mile End.
node.description: As several states get set to welcome incoming travellers when border restrictions are repealed, vaccination disparity remains a problem, with public health experts concerned that some disadvantaged,Â Aboriginal and multicultural communities are unprepared.
node.content:
["Public health experts are warning that poorer suburbs, as well as Aboriginal and multicultural communities, have\u00a0been left unprepared for the opening of state borders and inevitable COVID-19 outbreaks.", "With interstate travel resuming to South Australia, Tasmania and Queensland\u00a0within days or weeks, many people in disadvantaged areas remain unprotected.", "\"The gap is actually widening between local government areas where they have a higher rate [of vaccinations] and [those with] lower rates,\"\u00a0said John Glover, the head of the Public Health Information Development Unit at Torrens University.", "\"The difference across the cities is quite stark, and the difference between the city and the regional area in \u2026 Queensland, South Australia and Western Australia is quite stark.\"", "While South Australia is set to open its borders to interstate travellers this week \u2014 with the expectation the virus will come with them\u2014\u00a0some of the state's\u00a0communities are among Australia's least-vaccinated against COVID-19.", "Among all of Australia's metropolitan council areas, the City of Playford to\u00a0Adelaide's north had the lowest\u00a0double-vaccination rate last week, at\u00a060.8 per cent.", "In Playford \u2014 which includes the suburbs of Elizabeth,\u00a0Smithfield and Munno Para \u2014 there are\u00a0strong correlations between low vaccination rates and high levels of unemployment, Professor Glover said.", "", "
Professor John Glover is warning\u00a0of glaring disparities in vaccination uptake.(ABC News: Eric Tlozek)
", "\"While it varies hugely within Playford, overall, these are areas with highly disadvantaged people,\" he said.", "\"Australia has generally been a country where vaccination rates have been high.", "High levels of disadvantage in some areas will pose a major challenge to attempts to bring Playford up to the vaccination rate of other areas, Professor Glover said.", "\"Davoren Park \u2014\u00a0nationally, from all of the capital cities \u2014\u00a0is either the first- or second-most disadvantaged area in Australia. That's just about on any indicator you want to pick,\" he said.", "\"It's going to be a really long-term battle to get those rates up to a point where the government feels comfortable, around 90 per cent.\"", "Rates for young Indigenous people also remain low, as do some suburbs with high numbers of migrants.", "Community leaders say language barriers, higher rates of insecure and shift work, and social media misinformation are the main reasons that vaccination rates are low.", "\"Those barriers, those issues [are] really affecting the communities,\" Afghan community leader Hussain Rezaiat said.", "\"Some work needs to be done to address some of those challenges and barriers.\"", "", "
Afghan community leader Hussain Rezaiat is working to promote vaccination.(ABC News: Eric Tlozek)
", "SA Health started a project to address this problem two months ago.", "\"We've trained 200 organisations and [more than]\u00a0500 leaders to go out and have those conversations with their communities,\" said\u00a0Wellbeing SA's executive director of prevention and population health, Katina D'Onise.", "Data shows areas of low vaccine uptake in Victoria and New South Wales have largely caught up to other areas, after state governments realised they needed to increase their engagement with target groups.", "", "
Dr Katina D'Onise has been working\u00a0on community programs aimed at boosting vaccination.(ABC News: Eric Tlozek)
", "However, the help came too late in the Sydney and Melbourne outbreaks, when many people on lower incomes were still moving around for work and could not afford to stay home.", "
'Not as egalitarian as we think'
", "Professor Duckett said the pandemic had highlighted the seriousness of the problem of social and economic inequality in Australia.", "\"We pride ourselves in Australia of being an egalitarian society but what COVID revealed was that we're not as egalitarian as we think,\" he said.", "\"Vaccination rates were lower amongst lower-income people, people with lower education, First Nations Australians.", "\"We've got to actually recognise these problems and do something about it.\"", "", "
Dr Katina D'Onise delivers an information session on vaccination.(ABC News: Eric Tlozek)
", "That is especially important as Australia rolls out booster shots for the next phase of the pandemic.", "\"What did we get right and what did we get wrong and are we going to make sure that say, the booster program, is not going to be equally inequitable?\"\u00a0Professor Duckett asked.", "He also warned that something important was missing from government pandemic roadmaps: a recovery phase.", "\"It's not enough for the emergency to end \u2014 governments will need to deal with the damage it has caused, damage that is disproportionately higher in disadvantaged areas,\" he said.", "That means that, with the virus waning, vaccination was still only part of the battle.", "", "
COVID cases surging across several European countries
"]
